p: Microbial strains from American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) were used in this study for preliminary antimicrobial assays, which included methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (SA), methicillin-resistant S. aureus ATCC 33591 (SR), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212 (EF), Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (EC), Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 35657 (KP), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (PA), and Candida albicans ATCC 10231 (CA). Two clinical non-albicans strains, Candida glabrata ND31 (CG) and Candida tropicalis PNT20 (CT), which were provided by Anh et al. [ 33] and clinical isolates (15 E. coli and 15 K. pneumoniae), which were isolated from District 2 Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, in 2016, were also applied for antimicrobial investigation on the potential extracts.
